name: Cisco ESA
description: This app supports investigation on the Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA) device
latest_tested_versions: Cisco Secure Email Gateway C100V Version: 16.0.0-050

cluster_mode.description: Check if ESA is deployed in cluster mode
cluster_mode.name: cluster_mode

actions.verbose:
Parse and decode URL from "secure-web.cisco.com" to get the redirected URL.
  • It will accept the entire URL:

    http://secure-web.cisco.com/{random_chars}/https%3A%2F%2Fmy.phantom.us%2F4.1%2Fdocs%2Fapp_reference%2Fphantom_ciscoesa

  • Everything except the protocol:

    secure-web.cisco.com/{random_chars}/https%3A%2F%2Fmy.phantom.us%2F4.1%2Fdocs%2Fapp_reference%2Fphantom_ciscoesa

  • Or just the quoted section:

    https%3A%2F%2Fmy.phantom.us%2F4.1%2Fdocs%2Fapp_reference%2Fphantom_ciscoesa

example_values: https://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.ASP#:~:text=URL Encoding (Percent Encoding)&text=URLs can only be sent,followed by two hexadecimal digits.
Parsed from secure-web.cisco.com URL and decoded

actions.verbose:
This action is used to query "Query-based Reports" which counts various events in your appliance against a user-specified entity such as IP address, domain name, etc. for a specified duration.
If start_time and end_time are not given, then the report will be queried for the last 250 days.
If either start_time or end_time is provided, then the report will be queried for 250 days relative to the given parameter.
Following is the mapping of the report title and its corresponding entity that can be provided to filter reports:
Report TitleEntity Value
Internal UsersEmail ID of the internal user (e.g. user@example.com)
Incoming Mail: DomainsDomain name (e.g. abc.com)
Incoming Mail: IP AddressesIPv4 or IPv6 address
Incoming Mail: Network OwnersName of the network owner (e.g. Xyz Corporation)
Outgoing Senders: DomainsDomain name (e.g. abc.com)
Outgoing Senders: IP AddressesIPv4 or IPv6 address
Outgoing DestinationsDomain name (e.g. abc.com)
Outgoing Content FiltersName of the outgoing Content Filter
Virus TypesName of virus
Inbound SMTP AuthenticationDomain name (e.g. abc.com)
Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Outgoing PolicyName of the DLP policy

The action supports limiting the number of items returned using the limit parameter. If the limit parameter is 0, then the action will fetch no data for the selected report(s). If the limit is not specified, the action will fetch by default 10 items for all specified reports. For a particular report, if the limit specified is greater than the available data, the action will fetch all data for that report.

filter_value.description: Entity value to filter the results
filter_value.name: filter_value

starts_with.description: Retrieve items starting with specified filter value
starts_with.name: starts_with

limit.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve
limit.name: limit

offset.description: Starting index of overall result set
offset.name: offset

order_by.description: The attribute by which to order the data in the response
order_by.name: order_by

actions.description: List all dictionaries available in Cisco ESA
List all entries of an ESA dictionary

ignorecase.description: Indicates if the term that needs to be matched is case-sensitive (False) or not case-sensitive (True)
ignorecase.name: ignorecase

wholewords.description: Indicates if the words need to be matched completely (True) or not completely (False).
wholewords.name: wholewords

words.description: A list of terms to add to a dictionary. It takes a comma separated list with the structure "word1|weight1" or "word1|weigh1|prefix" (for smart identifiers)
words.name: words

actions.description: Add an entry to an ESA dictionary
actions.verbose: Per the documentation, the action will handle escaping special regex character prior to adding to the dictionary.

dictionary_name.description: Name of dictionary to add an item to
dictionary_name.name: dictionary_name

words.description: A list of terms to add to a dictionary. It takes a comma separated list with the structure "word1|weight1" or "word1|weigh1|prefix" (for smart identifiers).
words.name: words

actions.description: Remove an entry from an ESA dictionary
actions.verbose: Per the documentation, the action will handle escaping special regex character prior to removing from the dictionary.

dictionary_name.description: Name of dictionary to remove an item from
dictionary_name.name: dictionary_name

words.description: A list of terms to remove from the dictionary. It takes a comma separated list of words.
words.name: words

actions.description: Add users to an Incoming Mail Policy

sender_config.description: This is either "sender" or "sender_not" which then contains the list of domain_entries.
sender_config.name: sender_config

sender.description: Comma separated list of domain_entries for sender (e.g.: user@example.com,User@,@example.com,@.example.com,user@[1.2.3.4],@[1.1.2.3], user@[ipv6:2001:db8::1])
sender.name: sender

sender_not.description: Comma separated list of domain_entries for sender_not (e.g.: user@example.com,User@,@example.com,@.example.com,user@[1.2.3.4],@[1.1.2.3], user@[ipv6:2001:db8::1])
sender_not.name: sender_not

receiver.description: Comma separated list of domain_entries for receiver (e.g.: user@example.com,User@,@example.com,@.example.com,user@[1.2.3.4],@[1.1.2.3], user@[ipv6:2001:db8::1])
receiver.name: receiver

receiver_not.description: Comma separated list of domain_entries for receiver_not (e.g.: user@example.com,User@,@example.com,@.example.com,user@[1.2.3.4],@[1.1.2.3], user@[ipv6:2001:db8::1])
receiver_not.name: receiver_not

operation.description: Boolean logic between receiver  and receiver_not domain_entries. The values can be and or or" .
operation.name: operation

raw_json.description: Raw JSON payload for add policy items action.
raw_json.name: raw_json

actions.description: Search messages in  the other quarantine that match multiple attributes

start_date.description: The starting point of the time period for the query. It specifies the date and time from which data should be retrieved, formatted as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:00.000Z.
start_date.name: start_date

end_date.description: The ending point of the time period for the query. It specifies the date and time up to which data should be retrieved, formatted as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:00.000Z.
end_date.name: end_date

quarantines.description: This parameter defines the quarantines to search for. Comma separated list of quarantines (e.g.: Outbreak,Virus,File Analysis,Unclassified,Policy).
quarantines.name: quarantines

offset.description: Specify an offset value to retrieve a subset of records starting with the offset value. Offset works with limit, which determines how many records to retrieve starting from the offset.
offset.name: offset

limit.description: Specify the number of records to retrieve.
limit.name: limit

subject_filter_by.description: Filter logic to filter the Subject field.
subject_filter_by.name: subject_filter_by

subject_filter_value.description: Subject value to used to filter Subjects using subjectFilterBy logic.
subject_filter_value.name: subject_filter_value

originating_esa_ip.description: The IP address of the ESA in which the message was processed.
originating_esa_ip.name: originating_esa_ip

attachment_name.description: The name of the attachment available in the searched emails.
attachment_name.name: attachment_name

attachment_size_filter_by.description: Filter logic to filter the attachments.
attachment_size_filter_by.name: attachment_size_filter_by

attachment_size_from_value.description: Specify an attachment size in KB. This is applicable only for attachmentSizeFilterBy=ragne or attachmentSizeFilterBy=more_than
attachment_size_from_value.name: attachment_size_from_value

attachment_size_to_value.description: Specify an attachment size in KB. This is applicable only for attachmentSizeFilterBy=ragne or attachmentSizeFilterBy=less_than
attachment_size_to_value.name: attachment_size_to_value

order_by.description: Specify how to order to retrieved messages.
order_by.name: order_by

order_dir.description: Specify order direction for retrieved messages.
order_dir.name: order_dir

envelope_recipient_filter_by.description: Filter logic to filter the email Recipient.
envelope_recipient_filter_by.name: envelope_recipient_filter_by

envelope_recipient_filter_value.description: The value to search for. This is a user defined value. For example: envelopeRecipientFilterValue=user.
envelope_recipient_filter_value.name: envelope_recipient_filter_value

envelope_sender_filter_by.description: Filter logic to filter the email Sender.
envelope_sender_filter_by.name: envelope_sender_filter_by

envelope_sender_filter_value.description: The value to search for. This is a user defined value. For example: envelopeSenderFilterValue=user.
envelope_sender_filter_value.name: envelope_sender_filter_value

actions.description: Release a message that matches the mid attribute from a pov quarantine.

mids.description: POV quarantine message ids to be released.
mids.name: mids

actions.description: Search messages in  the spam quarantine that match multiple attributes

order_by.description: Specify how to order to retrieved messages.
order_by.name: order_by

order_dir.description: pecify order direction for retrieved messages.
order_dir.name: order_dir

envelope_recipient_filter_operator.description: Filter logic to filter the email Recipient.
envelope_recipient_filter_operator.name: envelope_recipient_filter_operator
